# Data process




## Cuba


### Wave 1


#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `PTOLDBP` |`PBPYEAR`|`age`|
|-|-|-|-|
| **Label** | `told had high blood pressure` |`when told high blood pressure?`|`age`|
| **Table name**  | `1066-Cuba-Baseline` | `1066-Cuba-Baseline` |`age`|
| **Categories** | `0 = no`<br/>`1 = yes` |`1 = 0-5 years ago`<br/>`2 = 5-10 years ago`<br/>`3 = more than 10 years ago`|`continuous`|
| **Missings** | `NA` | `NA` |`999 = Missing`|
| **Description** |  |  |  |

```{r assign cuba_w1, echo=F}

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 't1066_cuba_w1','10-66.1066-Cuba-Baseline',variables=list('PTOLDBP','PBPYEAR'), missings = T)
t1066_cuba_w1 <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_cuba_w1')
load(paste0(datafolder,"cuba_w1/age.RData"))
t1066_cuba_w1 <- left_join(t1066_cuba_w1,age, by="id")
rm(age)

```

```{r local cuba_w1, echo=F}

vbl <- t1066_cuba_w1$PTOLDBP
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(t1066_cuba_w1)[2])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(t1066_cuba_w1, aes(x=factor(PTOLDBP))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

vbl <- t1066_cuba_w1$PBPYEAR
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(t1066_cuba_w1)[3])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(t1066_cuba_w1, aes(x=factor(PBPYEAR))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

vbl <- t1066_cuba_w1$age

```


#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_hypertension` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `keep up 0 into 0`
* `keep up 1 into 1`
* `NA into 999`

To compute `h_hypertension_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `h_hypertension == 0 into 996`
* `if h_hypertension == 1 h_hypertension_age = age - (PBYEAR - 1)*5 (if PBYEAR == 3, age-10; if PBYEAR == 2, age-5; if PBYEAR == 1, age)`
* `otherwise into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo cuba_w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
t1066_ds_cuba_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_cuba_w1$id)
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$h_hypertension <- car::recode(t1066_cuba_w1$PTOLDBP, "NA = 999")

# Continuous variable harmonization
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$h_hypertension_age <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$id)) 
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$h_hypertension == 0)] <- 996
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$h_hypertension == 1 & !is.na(t1066_cuba_w1$PBPYEAR) & t1066_cuba_w1$age != 999)] <- t1066_cuba_w1$age[which(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$h_hypertension == 1 & !is.na(t1066_cuba_w1$PBPYEAR) & t1066_cuba_w1$age != 999)] - (t1066_cuba_w1$PBPYEAR[which(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$h_hypertension == 1 & !is.na(t1066_cuba_w1$PBPYEAR)  & t1066_cuba_w1$age != 999)] - 1)*5

```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

```{r descript cuba_w1, echo=F}

kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(t1066_ds_cuba_w1, aes(x=factor(h_hypertension))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

vbl <- t1066_ds_cuba_w1$h_hypertension_age
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label_age)

ggplot(t1066_ds_cuba_w1, aes(h_hypertension_age)) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label_age) + ylab("Frequency")+xlim(55,100)#+scale_y_continuous(breaks=c(0,2,4,6,8))

```


#### Validation


#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_hypertension` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `PTOLDBP == 0 and f_PTOLDBP == 0 into 0`
* `PTOLDBP == 1 or f_PTOLDBP == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_hypertension_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_hypertension == 1 in w2 and 0 in w1, h_hypertension_age = age-(year of interview w2-year of interview w1)/2`
* `if h_hypertension == 1 in w2 and in w1, h_hypertension_age from w1`
* `if h_hypertension == 0, h_hypertension_age = 996`
* `h_hypertension == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo cuba_w2}

t1066_cuba_w2 <- left_join(t1066_cuba_w2, t1066_ds_cuba_w1, by = "id")

# Categorical variable harmonization
t1066_ds_cuba_w2 <- tibble(id=t1066_cuba_w2$id)
t1066_ds_cuba_w2$h_hypertension <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_cuba_w2$id))
t1066_ds_cuba_w2$h_hypertension[which(t1066_cuba_w2$f_PTOLDBP == 0 & (t1066_cuba_w2$h_hypertension != 1 | is.na(t1066_cuba_w2$h_hypertension)))] <- 0
t1066_ds_cuba_w2$h_hypertension[which(t1066_cuba_w2$f_PTOLDBP == 1 | ((!is.na(t1066_cuba_w2$f_PTOLDBP)) & t1066_cuba_w2$h_hypertension == 1))] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
t1066_ds_cuba_w2$h_hypertension_age <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_cuba_w2$id))
t1066_ds_cuba_w2$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_cuba_w2$h_hypertension==0)] <- 996
t1066_ds_cuba_w2$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_cuba_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_cuba_w2$h_hypertension==0 & t1066_cuba_w2$age != 999)] <- t1066_cuba_w2$age[which(t1066_ds_cuba_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_cuba_w2$h_hypertension==0 & t1066_cuba_w2$age != 999)] - (t1066_cuba_w2$yintw_w2[which(t1066_ds_cuba_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_cuba_w2$h_hypertension==0 & t1066_cuba_w2$age != 999)] - t1066_cuba_w2$yintw_w1[which(t1066_ds_cuba_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_cuba_w2$h_hypertension==0 & t1066_cuba_w2$age != 999)])/2
t1066_ds_cuba_w2$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_cuba_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_cuba_w2$h_hypertension==1)] <- t1066_cuba_w2$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_cuba_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_cuba_w2$h_hypertension==1)]

```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

```{r descript cuba_w2, echo=F}

vbl <- t1066_ds_cuba_w2$h_hypertension
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(t1066_ds_cuba_w2, aes(x=factor(h_hypertension))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

vbl <- t1066_ds_cuba_w2$h_hypertension_age
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label_age)
kable(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Values")
pander(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(t1066_ds_cuba_w2, aes(h_hypertension_age)) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label_age) + ylab("Frequency")+xlim(55,95)#+scale_y_continuous(breaks=c(0,2,4,6,8))

```


#### Validation

```{r crosstabulation cuba_w2, echo=F}

AfterH <- table(t1066_ds_cuba_w2$h_hypertension)
X <- c(
  sum(t1066_cuba_w2$f_PTOLDBP == 0 & (t1066_cuba_w2$h_hypertension != 1 | is.na(t1066_cuba_w2$h_hypertension)),na.rm=T),
  sum(t1066_cuba_w2$f_PTOLDBP == 1 | ((!is.na(t1066_cuba_w2$f_PTOLDBP)) & t1066_cuba_w2$h_hypertension == 1),na.rm=T)
)
BeforeH <- c(X[1:2],length(t1066_cuba_w2$id)-sum(X))
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("all 0->0","some 1->1","NA->999")
kable(C)

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_hypertension` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `PTOLDBP == 0 and f_PTOLDBP == 0 into 0`
* `PTOLDBP == 1 or f_PTOLDBP == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_hypertension_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_hypertension == 1 in w2 and 0 in w1, h_hypertension_age = age-(year of interview w2-year of interview w1)/2`
* `if h_hypertension == 1 in w2 and in w1, h_hypertension_age from w1`
* `if h_hypertension == 0, h_hypertension_age = 996`
* `h_hypertension == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo UCh_w2}

t1066_UCh_w2 <- left_join(t1066_UCh_w2, t1066_ds_UCh_w1, by = "id")

# Categorical variable harmonization
t1066_ds_UCh_w2 <- tibble(id=t1066_UCh_w2$id)
t1066_ds_UCh_w2$h_hypertension <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_UCh_w2$id))
t1066_ds_UCh_w2$h_hypertension[which(t1066_UCh_w2$f_PTOLDBP == 0 & (t1066_UCh_w2$h_hypertension != 1 | is.na(t1066_UCh_w2$h_hypertension)))] <- 0
t1066_ds_UCh_w2$h_hypertension[which(t1066_UCh_w2$f_PTOLDBP == 1 | ((!is.na(t1066_UCh_w2$f_PTOLDBP)) & t1066_UCh_w2$h_hypertension == 1))] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
t1066_ds_UCh_w2$h_hypertension_age <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_UCh_w2$id))
t1066_ds_UCh_w2$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_UCh_w2$h_hypertension==0)] <- 996
t1066_ds_UCh_w2$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_UCh_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_UCh_w2$h_hypertension==0)] <- t1066_UCh_w2$age[which(t1066_ds_UCh_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_UCh_w2$h_hypertension==0)] - (t1066_UCh_w2$yintw_w2[which(t1066_ds_UCh_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_UCh_w2$h_hypertension==0)] - t1066_UCh_w2$yintw_w1[which(t1066_ds_UCh_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_UCh_w2$h_hypertension==0)])/2
t1066_ds_UCh_w2$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_UCh_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_UCh_w2$h_hypertension==1)] <- t1066_UCh_w2$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_UCh_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_UCh_w2$h_hypertension==1)]

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_hypertension` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `keep up 0 into 0`

To compute `h_hypertension_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `h_hypertension == 0 into 996`
* `if h_hypertension == 1 h_hypertension_age = age - (PBYEAR - 1)*5 (if PBYEAR == 3, age-10; if PBYEAR == 2, age-5; if PBYEAR == 1, age)`
* `otherwise into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo RCh_w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
t1066_ds_RCh_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_RCh_w1$id)
t1066_ds_RCh_w1$h_hypertension <- car::recode(t1066_RCh_w1$PTOLDBP, "NA = 999")

# Continuous variable harmonization
t1066_ds_RCh_w1$h_hypertension_age <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_RCh_w1$id)) 
t1066_ds_RCh_w1$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_RCh_w1$h_hypertension == 0)] <- 996
t1066_ds_RCh_w1$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_RCh_w1$h_hypertension == 1 & !is.na(t1066_RCh_w1$PBPYEAR) & t1066_RCh_w1$age != 999)] <- t1066_RCh_w1$age[which(t1066_ds_RCh_w1$h_hypertension == 1 & !is.na(t1066_RCh_w1$PBPYEAR) & t1066_RCh_w1$age != 999)] - (t1066_RCh_w1$PBPYEAR[which(t1066_ds_RCh_w1$h_hypertension == 1 & !is.na(t1066_RCh_w1$PBPYEAR)  & t1066_RCh_w1$age != 999)] - 1)*5
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_hypertension` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `keep up 0 into 0`
* `keep up 1 into 1`
* `NA into 999`

To compute `h_hypertension_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `h_hypertension == 0 into 996`
* `if h_hypertension == 1 h_hypertension_age = age - (PBYEAR - 1)*5 (if PBYEAR == 3, age-10; if PBYEAR == 2, age-5; if PBYEAR == 1, age)`
* `otherwise into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo DR_w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
t1066_ds_DR_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_DR_w1$id)
t1066_ds_DR_w1$h_hypertension <- car::recode(t1066_DR_w1$PTOLDBP, "NA = 999")

# Continuous variable harmonization
t1066_ds_DR_w1$h_hypertension_age <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_DR_w1$id)) 
t1066_ds_DR_w1$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_DR_w1$h_hypertension == 0)] <- 996
t1066_ds_DR_w1$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_DR_w1$h_hypertension == 1 & !is.na(t1066_DR_w1$PBPYEAR) & t1066_DR_w1$age != 999)] <- t1066_DR_w1$age[which(t1066_ds_DR_w1$h_hypertension == 1 & !is.na(t1066_DR_w1$PBPYEAR) & t1066_DR_w1$age != 999)] - (t1066_DR_w1$PBPYEAR[which(t1066_ds_DR_w1$h_hypertension == 1 & !is.na(t1066_DR_w1$PBPYEAR)  & t1066_DR_w1$age != 999)] - 1)*5

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_hypertension` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `PTOLDBP == 0 and f_PTOLDBP == 0 into 0`
* `PTOLDBP == 1 or f_PTOLDBP == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_hypertension_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_hypertension == 1 in w2 and 0 in w1, h_hypertension_age = age-(year of interview w2-year of interview w1)/2`
* `if h_hypertension == 1 in w2 and in w1, h_hypertension_age from w1`
* `if h_hypertension == 0, h_hypertension_age = 996`
* `h_hypertension == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo DR_w2}

t1066_DR_w2 <- left_join(t1066_DR_w2, t1066_ds_DR_w1, by = "id")

t1066_ds_DR_w2 <- tibble(id=t1066_DR_w2$id)
t1066_ds_DR_w2$h_hypertension <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_DR_w2$id))
t1066_ds_DR_w2$h_hypertension[which(t1066_DR_w2$f_PTOLDBP == 0 & (t1066_DR_w2$h_hypertension != 1 | is.na(t1066_DR_w2$h_hypertension)))] <- 0
t1066_ds_DR_w2$h_hypertension[which(t1066_DR_w2$f_PTOLDBP == 1 | ((!is.na(t1066_DR_w2$f_PTOLDBP)) & t1066_DR_w2$h_hypertension == 1))] <- 1

t1066_ds_DR_w2$h_hypertension_age <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_DR_w2$id))
t1066_ds_DR_w2$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_DR_w2$h_hypertension==0)] <- 996
t1066_ds_DR_w2$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_DR_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_DR_w2$h_hypertension==0)] <- t1066_DR_w2$age[which(t1066_ds_DR_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_DR_w2$h_hypertension==0)] - (t1066_DR_w2$yintw_w2[which(t1066_ds_DR_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_DR_w2$h_hypertension==0)] - t1066_DR_w2$yintw_w1[which(t1066_ds_DR_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_DR_w2$h_hypertension==0)])/2
t1066_ds_DR_w2$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_DR_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_DR_w2$h_hypertension==1)] <- t1066_DR_w2$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_DR_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_DR_w2$h_hypertension==1)]

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_hypertension` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `PTOLDBP == 0 and f_PTOLDBP == 0 into 0`
* `PTOLDBP == 1 or f_PTOLDBP == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_hypertension_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_hypertension == 1 in w2 and 0 in w1, h_hypertension_age = age-(year of interview w2-year of interview w1)/2`
* `if h_hypertension == 1 in w2 and in w1, h_hypertension_age from w1`
* `if h_hypertension == 0, h_hypertension_age = 996`
* `h_hypertension == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo Ven_w2}

t1066_Ven_w2 <- left_join(t1066_Ven_w2, t1066_ds_Ven_w1, by = "id")

# Categorical variable harmonization
t1066_ds_Ven_w2 <- tibble(id=t1066_Ven_w2$id)
t1066_ds_Ven_w2$h_hypertension <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_Ven_w2$id))
t1066_ds_Ven_w2$h_hypertension[which(t1066_Ven_w2$f_PTOLDBP == 0 & (t1066_Ven_w2$h_hypertension != 1 | is.na(t1066_Ven_w2$h_hypertension)))] <- 0
t1066_ds_Ven_w2$h_hypertension[which(t1066_Ven_w2$f_PTOLDBP == 1 | ((!is.na(t1066_Ven_w2$f_PTOLDBP)) & t1066_Ven_w2$h_hypertension == 1))] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
t1066_ds_Ven_w2$h_hypertension_age <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_Ven_w2$id))
t1066_ds_Ven_w2$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_Ven_w2$h_hypertension==0)] <- 996
t1066_ds_Ven_w2$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_Ven_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_Ven_w2$h_hypertension==0)] <- t1066_Ven_w2$age[which(t1066_ds_Ven_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_Ven_w2$h_hypertension==0)] - (t1066_Ven_w2$yintw_w2[which(t1066_ds_Ven_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_Ven_w2$h_hypertension==0)] - t1066_Ven_w2$yintw_w1[which(t1066_ds_Ven_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_Ven_w2$h_hypertension==0)])/2
t1066_ds_Ven_w2$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_Ven_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_Ven_w2$h_hypertension==1)] <- t1066_Ven_w2$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_Ven_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_Ven_w2$h_hypertension==1)]

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_hypertension` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `PTOLDBP == 0 and f_PTOLDBP == 0 into 0`
* `PTOLDBP == 1 or f_PTOLDBP == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_hypertension_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_hypertension == 1 in w2 and 0 in w1, h_hypertension_age = age-(year of interview w2-year of interview w1)/2`
* `if h_hypertension == 1 in w2 and in w1, h_hypertension_age from w1`
* `if h_hypertension == 0, h_hypertension_age = 996`
* `h_hypertension == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo RP_w2}

t1066_RP_w2 <- left_join(t1066_RP_w2, t1066_ds_RP_w1, by = "id")

# Categorical variable harmonization
t1066_ds_RP_w2 <- tibble(id=t1066_RP_w2$id)
t1066_ds_RP_w2$h_hypertension <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_RP_w2$id))
t1066_ds_RP_w2$h_hypertension[which(t1066_RP_w2$f_PTOLDBP == 0 & (t1066_RP_w2$h_hypertension != 1 | is.na(t1066_RP_w2$h_hypertension)))] <- 0
t1066_ds_RP_w2$h_hypertension[which(t1066_RP_w2$f_PTOLDBP == 1 | ((!is.na(t1066_RP_w2$f_PTOLDBP)) & t1066_RP_w2$h_hypertension == 1))] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
t1066_ds_RP_w2$h_hypertension_age <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_RP_w2$id))
t1066_ds_RP_w2$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_RP_w2$h_hypertension==0)] <- 996
t1066_ds_RP_w2$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_RP_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_RP_w2$h_hypertension==0)] <- t1066_RP_w2$age[which(t1066_ds_RP_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_RP_w2$h_hypertension==0)] - (t1066_RP_w2$yintw_w2[which(t1066_ds_RP_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_RP_w2$h_hypertension==0)] - t1066_RP_w2$yintw_w1[which(t1066_ds_RP_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_RP_w2$h_hypertension==0)])/2
t1066_ds_RP_w2$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_RP_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_RP_w2$h_hypertension==1)] <- t1066_RP_w2$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_RP_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_RP_w2$h_hypertension==1)]

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_hypertension` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `keep up 0 into 0`
* `keep up 1 into 1`
* `NA into 999`

To compute `h_hypertension_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `h_hypertension == 0 into 996`
* `if h_hypertension == 1 h_hypertension_age = age - (PBYEAR - 1)*5 (if PBYEAR == 3, age-10; if PBYEAR == 2, age-5; if PBYEAR == 1, age)`
* `otherwise into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo UM_w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
t1066_ds_UM_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_UM_w1$id)
t1066_ds_UM_w1$h_hypertension <- car::recode(t1066_UM_w1$PTOLDBP, "NA = 999")

# Continuous variable harmonization
t1066_ds_UM_w1$h_hypertension_age <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_UM_w1$id)) 
t1066_ds_UM_w1$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_UM_w1$h_hypertension == 0)] <- 996
t1066_ds_UM_w1$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_UM_w1$h_hypertension == 1 & !is.na(t1066_UM_w1$PBPYEAR) & t1066_UM_w1$age != 999)] <- t1066_UM_w1$age[which(t1066_ds_UM_w1$h_hypertension == 1 & !is.na(t1066_UM_w1$PBPYEAR) & t1066_UM_w1$age != 999)] - (t1066_UM_w1$PBPYEAR[which(t1066_ds_UM_w1$h_hypertension == 1 & !is.na(t1066_UM_w1$PBPYEAR)  & t1066_UM_w1$age != 999)] - 1)*5

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_hypertension` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `keep up 0 into 0`
* `keep up 1 into 1`
* `NA into 999`

To compute `h_hypertension_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `h_hypertension == 0 into 996`
* `if h_hypertension == 1 h_hypertension_age = age - (PBYEAR - 1)*5 (if PBYEAR == 3, age-10; if PBYEAR == 2, age-5; if PBYEAR == 1, age)`
* `otherwise into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo RM_w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
t1066_ds_RM_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_RM_w1$id)
t1066_ds_RM_w1$h_hypertension <- car::recode(t1066_RM_w1$PTOLDBP, "2=1; 3=1; NA = 999")

# Continuous variable harmonization
t1066_ds_RM_w1$h_hypertension_age <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_RM_w1$id)) 
t1066_ds_RM_w1$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_RM_w1$h_hypertension == 0)] <- 996
t1066_ds_RM_w1$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_RM_w1$h_hypertension == 1 & !is.na(t1066_RM_w1$PBPYEAR) & t1066_RM_w1$age != 999)] <- t1066_RM_w1$age[which(t1066_ds_RM_w1$h_hypertension == 1 & !is.na(t1066_RM_w1$PBPYEAR) & t1066_RM_w1$age != 999)] - (t1066_RM_w1$PBPYEAR[which(t1066_ds_RM_w1$h_hypertension == 1 & !is.na(t1066_RM_w1$PBPYEAR)  & t1066_RM_w1$age != 999)] - 1)*5
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_hypertension` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `PTOLDBP == 0 and f_PTOLDBP == 0 into 0`
* `PTOLDBP == 1 or f_PTOLDBP == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_hypertension_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_hypertension == 1 in w2 and 0 in w1, h_hypertension_age = age-(year of interview w2-year of interview w1)/2`
* `if h_hypertension == 1 in w2 and in w1, h_hypertension_age from w1`
* `if h_hypertension == 0, h_hypertension_age = 996`
* `h_hypertension == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo RM_w2}

t1066_RM_w2 <- left_join(t1066_RM_w2, t1066_ds_RM_w1, by = "id")

# Categorical variable harmonization
t1066_ds_RM_w2 <- tibble(id=t1066_RM_w2$id)
t1066_ds_RM_w2$h_hypertension <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_RM_w2$id))
t1066_ds_RM_w2$h_hypertension[which(t1066_RM_w2$f_PTOLDBP == 0 & (t1066_RM_w2$h_hypertension != 1 | is.na(t1066_RM_w2$h_hypertension)))] <- 0
t1066_ds_RM_w2$h_hypertension[which(t1066_RM_w2$f_PTOLDBP == 1 | ((!is.na(t1066_RM_w2$f_PTOLDBP)) & t1066_RM_w2$h_hypertension == 1))] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
t1066_ds_RM_w2$h_hypertension_age <- rep(999,length(t1066_ds_RM_w2$id))
t1066_ds_RM_w2$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_RM_w2$h_hypertension==0)] <- 996
t1066_ds_RM_w2$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_RM_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_RM_w2$h_hypertension==0)] <- t1066_RM_w2$age[which(t1066_ds_RM_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_RM_w2$h_hypertension==0)] - (t1066_RM_w2$yintw_w2[which(t1066_ds_RM_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_RM_w2$h_hypertension==0)] - t1066_RM_w2$yintw_w1[which(t1066_ds_RM_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_RM_w2$h_hypertension==0)])/2
t1066_ds_RM_w2$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_RM_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_RM_w2$h_hypertension==1)] <- t1066_RM_w2$h_hypertension_age[which(t1066_ds_RM_w2$h_hypertension==1 & t1066_RM_w2$h_hypertension==1)]

```

```{r helpfunctions, echo=F}


labelling <- function(l.hds,m.hds,vbl_name,ds_lab = ds_label){
  
  # Labelling of the tibbles with categorical data and creating new tibbles with all missings recodified as NA

  for(name in names(l.hds)) {
    if(vbl_name %in% names(l.hds[[1]])){
      # In the aux_object we copy the old tibble to recodify all missing values as NA.
      aux_object <- l.hds[[name]]
      # Labelling of variables
      label(l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]]) <- label(aux_object[[vbl_name]]) <- ds_lab
      # Labelling of categories (for continues variables, only missing values)
      l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]] <- labelled(l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]], labels = cat_label)
      aux_object[[vbl_name]] <- car::recode(aux_object[[vbl_name]], "miss_values_vector=NA")
      # Labelling of categories (for categorical variables, only non-missing values)
      aux_object[[vbl_name]] <- labelled(aux_object[[vbl_name]], labels = cat_label[1:(length(cat_label)-9)])
      # Saving the recodified tibble in list m.hds
      m.hds[[name]] <- aux_object
      rm(aux_object)
    }
  }
  return(list(l.hds,m.hds))

}


labelling_c <- function(l.hds,m.hds,vbl_name,ds_lab=ds_label){
  
  # Labelling of the tibbles with continuous data and creating new tibbles with all missings recodified as NA

  for(name in names(l.hds)) {
    if(vbl_name %in% names(l.hds[[1]])){
      # In the aux_object we copy the old tibble to recodify all missing values as NA.
      aux_object <- l.hds[[name]]
      # Labelling of variables
      label(l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]]) <- label(aux_object[[vbl_name]]) <- ds_lab
      # Labelling of categories (for continues variables, only missing values)
      l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]] <- labelled(l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]], labels = cont_label)
      aux_object[[vbl_name]] <- car::recode(aux_object[[vbl_name]], "miss_values_vector=NA")
      # Saving the recodified tibble in list m.hds
      m.hds[[name]] <- aux_object
      rm(aux_object)
    }
  }
  return(list(l.hds,m.hds))

}


# Creation of summary tables for categorical data

summaries <- function(l.hds,m.hds,lnames,vbl_name){

  # Creation of columns with categories and labels
  t.hds <- frq(l.hds[[1]][vbl_name])[[1]][,c(1,2)] 
  # For each wave/population in l.hds, add the correponding values
  for (i in seq_along(l.hds)){
    t.hds[2+i] <- frq(l.hds[[i]][vbl_name])[[1]][,4] 
  }
  # Add sample size for each wave/population
  t.hds[2+length(cat_label),] <- c("n", "sample size", sapply(l.hds,function(wave) length(wave[[1]]))
  )
  # Add wave/population names
  names(t.hds)<-c("val", "label",lnames)
  return(t.hds)
  
}


# Creation of summary tables for continuous data

summaries_c <- function(l.hds,m.hds,lnames,vbl_name){

  # Creation of column with summary table categories
  t.summ <- summary(m.hds[[1]][vbl_name])[1:6]
  # Adding of missing/no-missing values categories
  t.hds <- c(substr(t.summ,1,regexpr(":", t.summ, fixed=T)-1),labels(Continuous_summary(l.hds[[1]][[vbl_name]], missing_values = miss_values_vector)$values_table)[[2]])
  # For each wave/population in l.hds, add the correponding values
  for (i in seq_along(l.hds)){
    # First, summary values
    t.summ <- summary(m.hds[[i]][vbl_name])[1:6]
    # Next, missing/no-missing values (the 1 in $values_table[1,] stands for absolute values, while a 2 would stand for percentages)
    t.hds <- cbind(t.hds,c(as.numeric(substr(t.summ,regexpr(":", t.summ, fixed=T)+1,nchar(t.summ))),as.numeric(Continuous_summary(l.hds[[i]][[vbl_name]],missing_values = miss_values_vector)$values_table[1,])))
  }
  # Add sample size for each wave/population
  t.hds <- rbind(t.hds,c("sample size", sapply(l.hds,function(wave) length(wave[[1]]))))
  # Add wave/population names
  dimnames(t.hds)[[2]] <- c(dimnames(summary(m.hds[[1]][vbl_name]))[[2]],lnames)
  return(t.hds)
  
}


# Save data tables

savingRD <- function(l.hds,vbl_name){
  
  for(index in seq_along(l.hds)){
    assign(vbl_name,l.hds[[index]])
    save(vbl_name,list = vbl_name, file = paste0(datafolder,names(l.hds)[index],"/",vbl_name,".RData"))
  }
  
}
```
